poem:
Title: "A Paranoia Distilled"

An extraction of terrors,
from shaded psyche sprung.
Relative in Massachusetts park,
anonymity the heavy cloak they've hung.

Faith in absence of sanity -
black plume on white dove's wing.
A peculiar paranoia grips,
within its shroud, captures everything.

Red wheels flash on green scape,
blind prejudice, a madness spun,
In hushed whispers, they iterate,
America's shadowed sun.
